This includes both verbal and nonverbal communication skills, such as speaking clearly and concisely, listening actively, and maintaining eye contact.
This is the ability to work with others towards a common goal, including being willing to share, compromise, and help others.
This is the ability to resolve disagreements peacefully and respectfully.
This is the ability to identify and solve problems in a systematic and effective way.
This is the ability to understand your own thoughts, feelings, and behaviors.
This involves the ability to develop and maintain positive relationships with others, including being friendly, supportive, and respectful.
This is the ability to regulate your emotions and behaviors in a healthy way.
This is the ability to understand and share the feelings of another person.
This is the ability to express your needs and wants in a clear and direct way, while respecting the rights of others.
